citation.article-title: Sphingobium vermicomposti sp. nov., isolated from vermicompost
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sphingobium vermicomposti sp. nov.
Sphingobium vermicomposti (ver.mi.com.pos′ti. L. masc. n. vermis worm; N.L. neut. n. compostum compost; N.L. gen. n. vermicomposti from compost produced by earthworms).
Colonies are yellow, circular and convex on PCA, Luria–Bertani agar, tryptic soy agar and Mueller–Hinton agar.
No growth is observed on m-faecal coliform (m-FC) medium.
Cells are Gram-negative-staining rods (0.95±0.23 μm long and 0.44±0.07 μm wide), motile by a polar flagellum.
Strictly aerobic.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Growth occurs at 15–37 °C (optimum approx. 30 °C), at pH 6–8 (optimum pH 7) and in the presence of 1 % NaCl.
Aesculin is hydrolysed.
Produces β-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine and valine arylamidases, trypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and acid and alkaline phosphatases.
Arbutin, d-galactose, d-glucose, lactose and l-rhamnose are used as single carbon sources in the absence of organic growth factors.
l-Arabinose is oxidized (API 20E).

Growth occurs with (μg per disc) sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim (23.75/1.25) but not with amoxicillin (25), gentamicin (10), ciprofloxacin (5), tetracycline (30), cephalothin (30), meropenem (10), ceftazidime (30), ticarcillin (75) or colistin sulfate (50).
The predominant fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c/9t/12t, C16 : 1 and C16 : 0.
The major respiratory quinone is Q-10.
The major polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine, phosphatidylcholine and a sphingoglycolipid.
Spermidine is produced.
Hexachlorocyclohexane is not degraded.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 62 mol%.
The type strain is VC-230T (=CCUG 55809T =DSM 21299T), isolated from homemade kitchen-waste vermicompost.
